Reviews.Title: Super snapper!!
Reviews.Author: Nse Ette
Reviews.Content: I've been a Fujifilm faithful ever since my first digicam, the FP1300, seven digital cameras ago in 2001. With the Z10fd, it's easy to see why; tiny, sleek eye catching design (curvy and retro looking), intuitive, easy to use interface, and great image quality.The Z10 is a 7 megapixel camera with 25MB internal memory. I made sure I got a large memory card, a 1GB XD card (the camera also takes SD and SDHC memory cards) which stores 294 images at the highest resolution, and 18.7 minute movie clips (640x480 at 30fps).Having owned two cameras in the Z series; the Z1 and Z3, comparisons are inevitable. The first thing of note is that you no longer require the cradle to charge the camera, or download photos/movies/sound clips. It was quite a pain having to lug that around everywhere.As with those two, the camera powers on by sliding back the lens cover. One gripe I have though is that there isn't a dedicated button for movie mode anymore. You must now go into the menu to access it, but I can live with that. There's only one button on top of the camera, the shutter button, everything else in located on the back, beside the LCD.The 2.5 inch LCD display is toughened and scratch/break resistant. The resolution is excellent. The camera has 3x optical zoom which it does without extending out of the camera body, like most other cameras.The battery charges in about an hour, much quicker than the 140 minutes stated in the manual. Camera start up is very quick too, just under 2 seconds from my timing.The menu is even further simplified. If, for example, you select one out of the 18 shooting modes (i.e. Manual, Auto, Natural & Flash, Natural light, Party, Sports -for moving objects, etc. There's even a mode for Text), the screen displays text explaining what each mode is, with crystal clear sample images to illustrate. Each mode makes life easier for people like me who aren't into much tinkering to achieve great results. Natural & Flash is one of my favourites as it takes two images; one with flash, and one with natural light near simultaneously, and you get to select one, or keep both. Most times, the photo taken in natural light comes out tops.Movies are shot in 30fps, TV quality mode, which is becoming standard in digicams these days. You can select either the higher quality of 640x480, or lower quality of 320x240 (which gives longer clips). Quality is very good, and it's amazing the way the camera adapts to changes in light intensity while shooting (e.g. moving from a darker indoors atmosphere to a sunny exterior).Then we come to the major feature, face detection mode. This is a welcome feature for people like me who while handing my camera to strangers to "please take a photo of me", hope and pray that the photo taken manages to come out focused and okay at least. In this mode, the camera locks onto facial features, up to ten faces at a time, and automatically selects the best exposure for the shot as well as eliminates red-eye, enabling great shots to be taken every time. You can also use face detection mode with the self timer, ensuring those shots you take of yourself come out great. You can still use AF/AE lock as well.You can edit photos too; clip, rotate, and even send or receive images with other IR enabled cameras by infra red. I tried it with my PC (which is IR enabled) and it didn't work though, shame!The camera comes in a range of colours; black (my favourite), red, green, pink, blue, and orange.There's an AV cable to connect to your TV to view images or movie clips (it uses the same port as the USB and has a nice little cover for the port), and as ever, the Finepix software is first class. Photos up to A3 size can be printed in crystal clear resolution.This camera will not please those who are used to extensive manual settings and loads of tinkering with ISO levels, white balance, and other photographic jargon, but if you're like me, and just want to be able to whip out your camera, and without much fuss, capture the moment, this camera is for you. My current favourite gadget along with my iPod classic!

Reviews.Title: Poor low-light performance in an otherwise great camera
Reviews.Author: Dave Nat "dave_nat"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like the camera, but it failed woefully for my needs. The low-light performance is very poor, with significant noise present in any shots over ISO 200. Most small cameras have trouble in low-light, but after the success of the Fuji F20/F30/F40 series, I was hoping this camera would perform better. As it is, the Sony T-Series even though not great in low light, is worlds better. If you want to take indoor shots without flash, that's very important.Almost everything else about this camera is very good:-Nice construction-Easy to use-Good feature set-Good image quality in brightly lit environments-Nice "grid" option in viewfinderOne other issue - the "anti-shake" does not work very well, it is not true mechanical image stabilization, but rather a shutter-speed and iso boost.So, if you shoot only in bright environments, go for it. Otherwise, look further!

Reviews.Title: A cool camera for a cool price.
Reviews.Author: Steve Wilson "dewtwinkle"
Reviews.Content: Buy this camera because it is tiny, looks cool, and you think the price is low enough not to be bothered if you tire of the image quality.The first thing to be aware of is that when the camera is set to Auto mode, flash pictures are taken at ISO 800 and look very grainy.  In any mode other than Manual, the ISO is set to Auto ISO and you will see plenty of grain if the ISO is higher than 100, which is almost always the case.  To get the best image out of this camera you need to set it to Manual and set the ISO to 64.  The downside to this is that you will then need to hold the camera very steady or use a tripod to avoid blur, which totally negates the reason for buying such a camera in the first place.  Alternatively, you can use noise reducing software such as NoiseNinja and get quite decent results from ISO 200 or 400 images.Barrel distortion from the lens at wide angle is extreme.I doubt that most people would really notice the image quality issues in a 4x6 print.  It's a fine camera if you suddenly want to take a snapshot of people somewhere and post it on the internet.  Everyone you are taking a picture of will think the camera looks cool and they'll probably tell you the picture is great, too!Functionally, the camera works quite well and there's very little lag between pressing the "shutter" button and taking the picture.  It is a decent camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: fun camera, worth the money
Reviews.Author: Alicia Meyers
Reviews.Content: the camera is fun.  It takes decent pictures.  It has lots of features.  What it will not do is allow you to zoom in while taking video.  The camera works well for a camera but it's only okay as a video maker.Don't let other venders try to convince you to purchase an extended battery.  I tried to order this camera from 2 other websites that had it for a cheaper price.  I got an e-mail soon after I placed my order saying to call them persoanlly.  I called them because I was told that it was for my own security against fraud.  I was soon told that I should buy an extended battery because "this camera came with a battery that would only last 20 minutes".  When I refused the battery my order became cancelled.  After argueing with these poeople for about a week (& in 1 case told my camera wouldn't arrive for a month) I ordered it from Amazon.  I got the camera in about 3 days.  The battery is fine.  I had to charge once after about a week of normal use.I recommend this camera.  I also recommend getting it from Amazon & avoiding any hassle.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: LDW
Reviews.Content: Well I just got this one today and it is just what I wanted. If you are going for a sub compact camera then size should be your biggest consideration. This little Z series is about as small as they come. I got mine in Sunset Orange and love the bright color. I mean its so small you could almost put it on your keychain. I have a Razor cell phone and this little camera is slightly thicker, slightly shorter and ever so slightly wider.The weight is about the same, I can actually put it in the Razor's leather case and snap it shut!  The picture quality I am sure will continue to get better in the future but its pretty good now. Those who are reviewing this camera, remember its the size of a cell phone and it still delivers pretty nice pictures. The design does not allow it to be quite as good as the larger cameras. I mean the Canon SD1000 ELF series is the best in this category, and it is more expensive, considerably larger and the lens has to come out when trying to zoom. I was thinking of a camera I could slip into a cell phone case to carry with me just like my phone. I think I've found it here. The whole reason in my mind for a camera this small is portability. Thats means alot to me in that I will always have it on me and no more of this " if I had only had a camera with me " thoughts. The best pictures always come when we are not expecting them. I will no longer miss those shots. There are several really cool features on this little camera, one of which is really great macro shots, even has a text mode for taking pictures of script like all the spy movies used to have for photograghing secret documents. please be very careful to read the full description as I have only discussed the reason I feel this camera should be considered, SIZE.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Z10fd Has the Wow Factor !
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth V. Brennan
Reviews.Content: I own multiple compact cameras - and this is by far one of my favorites.  I have the Sony T10 and Samsung i6 and now the Fuji z10fd.First off, the hardest part about purchasing this camera is deciding which color to get - all the colors are so cool, you just kinda wanna collect them all :-).  I decided on the Green color.  I can always find it in a room full of other camera's : )Pros:* Cute, this little cutie is a conversation piece.* Small and easily fits in your pocket or purse.* Fast startup* Fast shooting* Takes SD film :)* User Friendly* Easy to Open/Close* Transfers pictures to other Fuji's "WOW"* Scrapbook / Playback features are Fun.Cons:* Unable to Zoom in/out while shooting video :(* Video starts playing automatically (playback mode) - I wish there was an option to turn that off - it gets annoying when trying to find videos.* Unable to easily switch between Picture mode and Video mode - without going thru the menu.

Reviews.Title: exactly what I need
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "nail artist"
Reviews.Content: The Finepix Z10fd is exactly the kind of camera I need for my business.  I'm a nail artist, and I need to be able to take clear, crisp, and up-close photos of hands and feet--and that's what I get with this subcompact little cutie.  The controls are very intuitive, also;  I didn't need the user's manual to figure out the basics, and only needed to peek at it couple of times for some of the more specific functions.  The 7.2 pixels give me a whole lot of image to work with later in my photo editing software.  I haven't had the opportunity to print anything yet, but when I do, I'll edit this review accordingly.Oh, and the fact that the camera is HOT PINK does nothing at all to diminish my pleasure in its use, in case anyone was wondering :D

Reviews.Title: Fuji Finepix Z10 Camera
Reviews.Author: Seachelle
Reviews.Content: This little camera is absolutely fantastic.  I bought it for our trip out west.  We came back home with over 400 beautiful pictures.  Easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Dont buy just because it is a Fuji
Reviews.Author: T. H. Kava
Reviews.Content: this camera is small, compact, light, but sadly it doesnt take crystal clear images...i've taken more than 100 trial shots in different modes and circumstances however this camera is far from satifying the minimum...evening shots are really bad...forget taking sharp landscape photos with it...the only good results you may get are with macro shots...it was a wrong choice...my recommendation to those who are thinking of buying this digital cameara is to think twice...

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, easy to use
Reviews.Author: M. Rom
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter bought this camera and LOVES it. She does not read instructions and has still had great success with a lot of the features. It is very easy to use and understand. The image stabilization is good, the picture quality is beautiful, and the video feature is a lot of fun. Great camera, great price.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Rebecca L. Lund "Becky"
Reviews.Content: I got my daughter this camera for Christmas.  I searched many and didn't want to spend a fortune for one because she is 13 and 13 year olds are not always as careful as they should be.  Well, I liked it so much that I am waiting for one for me to be delivered because I ordered one for myself.  It is a great camera at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Cute camera doesn't deliver
Reviews.Author: Barchetta
Reviews.Content: I pre-ordered this camera for my teenage daughter's birthday basedon Fuji's reputation for consistently delivering good qualitycameras, and the fact that my daughter loved the styling.After using the camera for a few weeks it was actually my daughterthat came to me with concerns about the picture quality. Indoor shotswith flash were especially poor and grainy. So back to Amazon it went,and we got a Canon SD1000 to replace it which we are thrilled with.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Rockwell "Rock"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  Very user friendly!  You don't have to know too much camera jargon to begin taking quality pictures.  If you take the time to really learn all the features of the camera, no doubt you will end up with professional quality photos. If you need to change the shooting mode (i.e, beach, museum, sports...), the camera explains each mode on the screen so you can choose one quickly and snap your shot. The software allows you to make several enhancements to the pictures.  My favorites are cropping and changing the pictures to black & white or sepia.  The camera itself couldn't be any sleeker. If you're looking for an affordable digital camera to grab & go without much fuss, treat yourself to this one.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, good pics
Reviews.Author: C
Reviews.Content: I had an olympus 7 megapixel digital camera that turned out to need a lot of manipulation before it took a decent picture. I finally gave up on it and bought this one because my sister has it and her pictures always came out much better than mine. I'm glad I did because this one is much easier to use, just point and click and you get great pictures. No need to fuss with the settings, etc.

Reviews.Title: no flash = bad pictures!
Reviews.Author: K. radford "secretina"
Reviews.Content: this is a decent camera for the price my only complaint is that if you like taking pictures in natural light (no flash) expect grainy noisy pictures. and just my luck i love to take pictures without a flash =[ .. all the other features of this camera are great! it's very compact and easy to use. i got it in wasabi green and i have to say it's a beautiful color! for a point and shoot this camera would definitely serve it's purpose..it also takes nice videos. just be warned if you like taking digital pictures with low lighting affects and no flash it will be a major disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Bought as a Christmas gift for my wife, she wanted a hot pink phone so I bought her this one, she loved it! Great quality pics and many picture options as well, computer software easy to install and camera is easy to use. Only con is that I feel the rechargeable battery it comes with should be able to last longer than it does. Other than that, one of the best cameras you can find in this color and I would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: Excellent novice camera.
Reviews.Author: Wilbur Lidzy "GuateStudio"
Reviews.Content: Has the automatic controls that a novice fotographer needs.  If you want easy switching of program modes or video mode, you had better learn the menu navigation.  The buttons are limited in scope, and not very user friendly.  If you want to take good pix, this is great because it can even take two of the same pose, one with flash and one natural.  Great for wedding guests.

Reviews.Title: Amazing for a tiny camera!
Reviews.Author: Amber Straight
Reviews.Content: For a camera smaller than my hand, this thing packs a punch.  The zoom is more than I would expect from such a tiny thing, and it takes pretty long videos.  The only problem with the video is you cant zoom in and out when shooting.There are so many different shooting options, I took this to a concert where we were in the back row of the balcony, and I got some great shots with it on the "night" setting.  Not very blurry, even with using the digital zoom.Perfect to stick in my pocket.  I would suggest a second battery if you are going to be traveling.I got a SDHC card for this- 4G, woohoo!  So far, I havent been able to fill it.  I doubt I ever will!  Im glad I bought this camera.  For the price, it was well worth it.I Despise the software that came with it, however.  I downloaded Googles "Picasa", it works much better.  If you get this camera, just know that the software is terrible.  BUT, the camera is GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: works great.
Reviews.Author: Deena Lettas
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's absolutely great. I haven't had any problems with it whatsoever and the battery doesn't take as long to charge as most other cameras. It takes awesome photos and it's so easy to use. The only complaint that I would have about this camera is that it doesn't zoom in as much as I'd like.

Reviews.Title: cute camera
Reviews.Author: Missa "Missa"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter as a 14th birthday present.  It is absolutely adorable, the color matches her phone & ipod.  The pictures are great, but we are having issues with the video.  Admittedly, this could be a user error since we have not read the manual. However,this will be the first camera that we have to read a manual.  All other cameras worked fine with a minimum of fumbling around.  Once we figure it out, the camera will be perfect!

Reviews.Title: Red eye removal doesn't work well
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: This camera was a disappointment.  I have a Z5 and got this for the red eye removal.  The face detection frequently will not detect the face of a child because a child's face moves a lot.  The red eye is not removed unless the face is detected.  Even when the face is detected the red eye is often not removed.  I love the Z5 I have, and other than the red eye removal I like this camera also.  The camera will provide a slide show with music accompaniment.  Small size and great user interface are good features.

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera for Good Price
Reviews.Author: Anthony Marks "youngtone"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife since it was a decent pink camera.  The price is basically the best thing about this camera.  There is nothing too special about the camera, but it does compare with all of the other point and shoot cameras in the 100-200 dollar range.  The only bad thing that I can say about the camera is that is gets a little fuzzy on the preview screen when you zoom in, but the picture comes out clear, so it's not a major factor.  Taking the price into factor this is a really good camera.  The pictures come out clear and it has roughly 10 picture modes that allow for you to take decent pictures in different environments.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Emily Purcell "embles"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. Nice and small, but it has so many cool features. Amazing color, too!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the money
Reviews.Author: B. Liu
Reviews.Content: For about little over $100, this camera is a great buy, perfact for fast home snap shots, with web friendly formats etc...uses cheap sd cards and come with some nice feature set ( almost too much features ) but can't beat it for the price !

Reviews.Title: a little disappointing but overal great
Reviews.Author: twowingsup "read on!!!!!!!!1"
Reviews.Content: If you are just putting pictures of Facebook or any other social networking site then this camera is for you. If your plans are more than just pictures of that sort then I would not recomend this camera. It takes great pictures but the software that comes with it is not so great. I wish I would have done a little more research and not just bought it because of the color but still it is a good camera.

Reviews.Title: beginner's camera
Reviews.Content: This is a really good camera for beginners. I received this camera as a b-day gift for my 13th. I must say that as my first digital camera it meets most of my expectations. The pictures get blurry once in a while to where it looks like there are two images. My opinion it is because it is sensitive to motion. What I like about it the most it has a really cool audio to where you can give yourself notes on pictures. Such as where it was taken. The video function is great too. Once in awhile you just need a video to share rather then a picture. It's probably a good idea to get this as a teenagers birthday gift. I personally love it.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix Z10
Reviews.Author: Terry Hand
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter and she loves it. From the pictures I saw that she had taken, they were very clear with great detail. I've always liked Fuji products and still do.

Reviews.Title: Poor shot quality!
Reviews.Author: C. Jackson
Reviews.Content: I'm no photography buff, I just wanted a point-and-shoot camera that would take decent pictures at parties and outdoor events. This camera is not it. Very, very poor shot quality no matter which mode I use. Pictures look ok in  their original state but if you zoom in at all the crappiness is instantly revealed. I will be putting mine up for sale on eBay and getting something else as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: This camera is not worth
Reviews.Author: Georgi
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the attractive color (green) and based on the reviews I came across. However, when I got it here to be honest I was quite disappointed. The camere make noise while zooming, and could not perform well while taking macro shots. Compared to my old 6.1MP Nikon, the Fuji is behind in picture quality and overall performance. It takes longer for the software to process the images taken. The Face Detection feature is almost useless, it is a good concept but it was poorly executed. For the money, in my oppinion, you could get a better camera. Might want to consider the Casio, Canon, Nikon or Sony units from the same price range!

Reviews.Title: What a terrible camera!
Reviews.Author: R. T. Gregg
Reviews.Content: As a professional photographer with 35 years experience, I have used many cameras.I chose the first generation of this camera, a Fuji Finepix Z1, and I loved that camera. After three years of use the electronic flash on that camera failed. Knowing that repair was not an option, I naturally gravitated to a later generation of the same camera which was presumably improved.The shutter lag on this camera is so long that I might as well press the shutter release and go sneak a smoke. Maybe there will be an image recorded by the time I get back.In Fuji's defense there were some features that have improved. The menu is easier to navigate, and the image review function is simplified and improved.Let's face it folks, great moments in life are very fleeting. If I am unable to grab the shot, they are just images in my memory, not my memory card. Shutter lag is THE ONLY DEAL that I concern myself with, if it concerns you, avoid this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love my camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Laura L. Stitzer "crystaldreams"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after shopping around for a while. I knew I wanted a good camera, and I was wanting a pink one. I am in love with this thing! It's great for me! If I need to sell stuff, I really enjoy the auction mode because it automatically takes smaller size pics and therefore it's easier to upload into the auction! It's also a wonderful shade of pink! I know I will be enjoying this camera for a while!!!

Reviews.Title: A good starter
Reviews.Author: T. Harris
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Crisp Pictures. My Girlfriend loves it. I would recommend this camera for its ease of use and its nice resolution value. A good camera for the casual photographer.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, lousy battery-life!
Reviews.Author: Grande Dame
Reviews.Content: I love the camera. The pictures are great but the battery didn't even last a full day of picture taking. The battery only lasted about 3 hrs or 150 pics. I ended up buying an extra battery to take on my vacation.

Reviews.Title: Wow! I am amazed at the picture quality.
Reviews.Author: Barbara Yarrington "Barbie"
Reviews.Content: We purchased three of these cameras for our children (well young adults) all in different colors. The first thing to grab my attention was the ease of use the second was the quality of the picture this camera was producing. My Husband and I purchased a Sanyo several months prior to buying these and we were happy with it until we saw the quality of the pictures of this camera. One of the features I like the best is the slide on the front turns the camera on and off, in addition to that it protects the lens. Now if they could design a camera to protect both the LCD and the Lens that would be perfect. I really like this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Find
Reviews.Author: Nicole Martino "NRM"
Reviews.Content: I originally purchached this camera for the color but found the features are fabulous. It is extremely easy to use and the picture quality is amazing. I have already purchased others for family members. It arrives quickly as well.

Reviews.Title: Great point and click camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Girlie "Personal Buyer :)"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter for her 11th birthday. We both love the camera, bought a memory card to expand how many pictures and videos it can hold. We can easily download the pictures from the camera to our MySpace pages and other picture sharing sites like Dropshots. The video isn't the best quality but for us, it works fine. BUT...we are not technical, are not looking for the best and WERE looking for a camera that would do what we needed it to do for a reasonable price. We found those things with this camera. And the battery life is AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Michael L. Miller
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. has plenty of features for one at this price point. Takes great pictures as well.

Reviews.Title: Awsome Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Randy Forrester "FunPhotoTips.com"
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these for my girls' birthdays and now want one for myself.  These are high-quality, economical, and easy to use point-and-shoots.  Very close and clear focusing allows great flower shots...And the girls went nuts over the hot pink!  Another quality product from a quality company.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: L Johns
Reviews.Content: This little camera is great. Good picture quality, easy to use, charge, and carry. Software easy to install and use. Many colors to choose from. Could have a little better zoom, but for the money, a winner.

Reviews.Title: A great buy!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This little camera is great!  Small, compact and takes excellent photos.  And with the SD cards (I bought mine on Amazon.com) being so cheap, it makes this camera a must have.  One issue, is that you have to make sure you review the instructions, at first I had a lot of blurry photos.  There's an anti-blur feature-  make sure it's on.  Great camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camara
Reviews.Author: B. Flint "army girl"
Reviews.Content: I love this camara even though I haven't used it much. Its face focus is awesome! It has many anemities to use to help make the perfect picture. Red eye, flash, face focus, blur button, etc...It also make videos and you can add your voice to it. You can download pics to your computer or straight to the printer and even to your TV!! I have no problems with this and can't wait to use it more!!

Reviews.Title: pink camera
Reviews.Author: Karen Kielasa-frontera "smart shopper"
Reviews.Content: Was looking for this specific hot pink camera and amazon had it for a great price new! I was also able to get shipping at a discount and arrived less than a week.My daughter's school trip was complete and took great pictures. The process was easy in ordering it. This was my first time using amazon.

Reviews.Title: it's pretty decent...
Reviews.Author: yumarlenehesayz
Reviews.Content: The camera works fine.  It's not something very extravagent...It does it's job.  The quality of the pics could be slightly better...However, they do look wonderful when hooked up to a TV.I'd recommend it to someone looking for a camera to take random pictures.  You do get your money's worth, but don't expect spectacular pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great buy.
Reviews.Author: AB "itprtslc"
Reviews.Content: Camera has great features (anti-blur, framing help, etc.) for the price.  One to keep in your pocket on trips!  Zooms in and out to capture wider and tighter shots. Quick download capability (even worked with program already on my computer, so I never needed to download the included disc. Although, if I do, I do believe there are special features included in the Fuji that I can use to enhance and edit photographs).  Only one complaint--the camera's color looks like it is fading from black to a purle hue.  That's okay, though.

Reviews.Title: Good point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: C. Felton
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I was looking for a small and reasonably priced point and shoot.  This camera fit the bill perfectly.  The camera powers up quickly, and the image quality is decent for a point and shoot.  I believe this is a great camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: I, really like the camera. Its small and handy. Wish someone would make a case that would protect the viewing screen.
Reviews.Author: Terry A. Prout
Reviews.Content: As I mentioned above, I like the camer, its small and light and can easily be carred in a pants pocket. I took it to Costa Rica the day after I receive the order from Amazon and worked through the instructions. I have a larger FujiFilm camer and the control function are nearly the same so the learning curve was fairly shallow. Again like the Camera and I will buy futur Fuji products.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: J_Starkey
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for my wife's Christmas gift. First off, the price was almost $50 cheaper than Best Buy's after Thanksgiving ad. The user friendlyness and picture quality are superb. Matter of fact , Im ordering a second one of these in black for me. An awesome camera.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Cat
Reviews.Content: My goal with this purchase was to find a pocket size camera that is easy to use with good photo quality.  This is it!  I normally purchase more professional grade cameras and really wasnt sure if I would enjoy this purchase.  I have been impressed with everything so far. My favorite thing about it is that it fits easily into my purse or pocket and is not bulky or heavy.

Reviews.Title: pocket picture time
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, it isn't quite the quality of my much more expensive and huge to hold SLR, but it has all the same features in a compact little sweetly orange package.  I carry it everywhere I go and wish I had bought it a long time ago...

Reviews.Title: Great for a 1st time camara
Reviews.Author: DMO
Reviews.Content: This camara has taken pretty nice pictures in different lights and settings. I think it is a pretty good camara for a first timer, it is very light and easy to carry.As well as a a big screen, sleek disign and an eye-poping color.

Reviews.Title: Finepix(wave blue)
Reviews.Author: John D. Gonzales
Reviews.Content: This camera is very nice.It takes great pictures and with a memory card you can record up to an hour of video.My girlfriend loves this camera and is trigger happy.Tons of pictures have gone on My Space already.This is the first Fuji product I have purchased and I was not disappointed.I recommend it for the price and the looks.

Reviews.Title: Finepix Z10
Reviews.Author: Shari Mitchell
Reviews.Content: After researching cameras to purchase for my teenage daughter I decided to go with the Fujifilm Finepix Z10fd.  Many of the stores were out of this product due to it's popularity.  Not only was I able to find it available on Amazon it was also the best price both online and in the stores.  I am very pleased with my purchase of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!
Reviews.Author: R. Clark
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal, 10% lower than anywhere else. My teen daughter is impressed with the ease of use and the quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: A. Fox "busymom2"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a Christmas present for myself from my husband.  It is in my favorite color, BLUE.  I have been a camera addict since I was 10 years old, when I was presented with my first camera by my equally camera-addicted uncle, Victor.I found it extremely easy to use.  The screen is big, and it is so simple to download to my Mac (iPhoto).  I carry this camera everywhere for quick snapping.  The feature that I look forward to using the most is the continuous shot mode.

Reviews.Title: Sleek!
Reviews.Author: Elvis K. Ntale
Reviews.Content: Not a bad buy.The zoom though is a little disappointingly close range.Also, the face recognition can be a little confusing but once you figure out how it works, this is a nifty sleek gadget. Sure better than my previous Finepix Z3.

Reviews.Title: cute camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara R.
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased for my daughter for Christmas.  She likes it and it takes good pictures but the software that goes with it is hard to work with.  She has accidentally deleted several pictures even though she has used digital cameras and lots of software programs before.  Turns out the software is not as user-friendly as the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good for a small package
Reviews.Author: TieDye Kid "Peace"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very small and the lens does not stick out when you turn it on - which is the main reason I chose it (after having 2 Kodaks get their lenses stuck and Kodak doing nothing for me, sure you can send it in and if they think it's not a warrantee issue they'll charge your credit card more than the camera is worth - so I won't be buying another Kodak)OK enough time spent bashing Kodak's bad product support - the Fuji seems to take pretty good pictures but does not take video.  The battery will give you about 150 pictures per charge which is good but I would get a second battery if this is going to be your only camera.  The picture quality is not quite as good as some larger camera's in the same mp range (my other camera is a Kodak Z710 which takes better looking pictures than the Fuji but the lens makes me nervous after the issues I had with the other two Kodaks).Bottom Line - We (it's primarily my wife's camera) are happy with it, and the small size makes it very handy for spontaneous pictures.

Reviews.Title: Fast, Sharp, EZ to use
Reviews.Author: R. T. Hood "Nikonmaster"
Reviews.Content: Gave this to my 17yr old and she filled a 1gb card in 24hrs.  She has used it outdoors at events and indoors where no flash is permitted and still achieved good images. I know the professional Fuji cameras are based on Nikons, so perhaps the companies are sharing technology.  Would explain the great pics...The HOT BLUE color makes quite a splash too. Good Deal!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix Z10fd 7.2MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Dr. Salome C. Nnoromele
Reviews.Content: The camera malfunctioned even before we could take a first picture with it. The battery got stuck inside, refused to pop out, and the camera could not take pictures. We called Fuji and sent it back to them. It is 4 weeks later and we are still to receive the camera back. They did acknowledge receipt of the product and are fixing it. I am pretty disappointed that we did not even use the camera once before it broke.

Reviews.Title: really bad camera
Reviews.Author: A. Hart
Reviews.Content: this camera takes terrible pictures the screen shows them with what looks like a film over them and the do not show up any better once they are down loaded to the computer or printed out. I have a 3.2mp digital that takes better pitcures. You will be disaponted if you get this camera. Fujifilm really messed up with this one.

Reviews.Title: cute but little else
Reviews.Author: D. Nash "scarlett_fire"
Reviews.Content: I was so eager to love this camera. I even pre-ordered it weeks in advance. Unfortunately I had to return it the next day -- the shots taken with this camera were not good at all.If you're into cute and don't care about image quality, than this is the camera for you (this one or possibly a Casio, which to my eyes makes the cutest cameras out there). But if you're looking for photographic quality, I'd suggest you look elsewhere, perhaps to Canon or Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful design, poor image quality
Reviews.Author: R. Koenig "Another Working Mom"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this camera badly.  The design of the camera was perfect for my needs - cute, compact, with a lens cover.  I wanted a "purse camera" for spontaneous snaps of my son, and this seemed to fit the bill perfectly.  Even though I wasn't looking for anything of professional quality, the image quality was so poor that I returned the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice... worth the money.
Reviews.Author: E. Card "epc"
Reviews.Content: After much research, Amazon was definitely the cheapest price.  Not a lot of features, but does the job.  Flash is almost too bright, pictures taken with the flash are super bright,,, which makes for an unusual pic if you are in a  club... fits nicely in an ipod sock.Also, the case not black so much as it is dark plum.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jane
Reviews.Content: I'm 14 and love this camera!! It's fun and the color is awesome! the zoom isn't very good or far, but the camera is great for a teenager.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Cirolia
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  The days of out of focus pictures are gone - the picture stabilazation feature is great.  So is the multiple face focus.  So far I haven't found anything I dislike about this camera.  Nice compact size with a view screen that is easy to see & use.

Reviews.Title: Bought it for my granddaughter's birthday that's coming up but ...
Reviews.Author: Sandic
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my granddaughter's birthday that's coming up but learned from her Dad that she is trying to get away from anything girly (pink included). Now I have to find something else. I tried taking picture and the camera works o.k.

Reviews.Title: Very good low budget camera
Reviews.Author: Denise Dorazio
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this camera, takes great pics has good features and seeing i got this for a replacement for a higher priced camera it basically does the job just as good until the time i'd like to get a new camera later on. Love the compact aspect..features are good but could be a bit better in switching from different modes and cropping or enlarging..i found most my other cameras those things were very direct and clear this for instance you get a screen message to hit the top snap shot button or u have to slide the front ope and close.. now i have not fully read the manual but all in all for the price im happy with it.

Reviews.Title: A Very Good Product
Reviews.Author: Richard W.
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what I was looking for and this item is something that fulfills my needs for what I want.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera.
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Wilcock
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera a few years ago for my wife, but I ended up using it quite a bit as well.  It's been great as a small compact and I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: I bought mine from DJsDealAlerts... Item was as described... Works great!... Another satisfied customer! :-)
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I bought mine from DJsDealAlerts... the packaging, shipping and camera condition was great! The camera is very easy to use, plus it shoots great close-ups. Close-ups was my main reason for getting this type of camera.The reason I put this here was because I waited too long to give DJsDealAlerts here on Amazon a 5 star rating. I am very very satisfied with DJsDealAlerts and Amazon for the camera I bought. Again, it's great for close-ups. I had taken a picture of a penny and I could see every scratch and dent on it clearly and up close... That's how good this type of camera is...

Reviews.Title: A good non-professional camera
Reviews.Author: Shane - AFR
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; swfParams.sessionId = "000-0000000-0000000"; swfParams.marketplaceID = "ATVPDKIKX0DER"; swfParams.salign = "LT"; swfParams.preset = "detail"; swfParams.mediaObjectId = "m127IJWLW3D6A9"; swfParams.autoPlayTimer = ""; } swfParams.xmlUrl = "http://www.amazon.com/gp/mpd/getplaylist-v2/" + movieID + "/000-0000000-0000000"; flashParams.wmode = "transparent"; swfParams.autoPlay = "1"; } if (document.getElementById('cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1duration')) { document.getElementById('cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1duration').style.display='none'; } cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1loadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion); } // ]]> var cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1RollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1RollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91k9-NSTMbS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1preplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1preplayImageId'); if (cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1preplay) { cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1preplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91k9-NSTMbS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1preplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91k9-NSTMbS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1preplay.parentNode; var cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1currentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1currentClick) { return cv_mo31GA4DFEHN8Y1currentClick(); } } } Length:: 3:25 MinsI have been using this camera for a couple years now and for the most part I have been very happy with its performance. My usage may very from yours, but what I use it for and what you may use it for are probably not that far off. I use this camera a lot to take pictures of small items like action figures and small detail objects for my Amazon reviews. I rarely use it for taking pictures outside or during life events as my cellphone does a good job with that.For fine detail pics and small object photos I need a camera that can focus well, resist shaking, and capture the very fine aspects of the object I'm photographing. This camera does a good job in achieving this need. With a built in anti-shake feature and an impressive zoom ability this little guy is capable of capturing very fine details.The only set back I have found is that the camera has some difficulty with low-light-level situations. With the flash off the camera can blur an image if not enough light is reflecting off the object being photoed. With the flash enabled an object that is being photoed closely by the camera can be overwhelmed by the bright light of the flash. If the object is farther back from the flash the object comes out okay, but the surrounding environment is dark do to the narrow coverage of the flash.Video presentation contains some pics of things I have photoed for reviews.

Reviews.Title: overpriced
Reviews.Author: chella
Reviews.Content: I bought this product when I was back in high school, at least 4 years ago. The product its self is good. Its not an amazing camera but it has captured my memories between then and now. Its small size makes it easy to just throw into my pocket, because i never carry a purse. And i love the bright colors! I myself bought the orange one. But the strange thing that i found is that it is so expensive on here. i spent about $80 on mine, new, at Walmart 4 or so years ago, and on here depending on the color there 200-300 dollars. The cameras are good, but there not that good. I wouldn't spend more than $100 on this particular product.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix
Reviews.Author: audreo
Reviews.Content: This camrea is easy to use with lots of Picture opitins to pick from. The only thing Im not impressed with it the quality of the pictures. Many have turned out fuzzy.

Reviews.Title: Eh, I don't get all the rave reviews for this....
Reviews.Author: Le'Bourne
Reviews.Content: Ok, this is my second real review on amazon, so I apologize if it isn't as precise as other reviewers. It's worthy to note, I am not an expert when it comes to photography either. So now, obviously, I am shopping around for a new camera. I used to have this: Fujifilm Finepix V10 5.1MP Digital Camera with 3.4x Optical Zoom (Orange) & I LOVED it. It was by far the best camera I have ever owned. When I purchased it, it was on sale for a little over $100, what a steal! Unfortunately, a friend dropped it, & it broke. By this time, the promotion was over & she wanted to replace it. Not wanting her to have to spend more than I originally had, we saw this Z for around the same price my original was. I thought because I loved my other finepix so much, that this would be a solid replacement, as I had developed trust in the name. Wrong.First, what is with this hiked price? I purchased this cam over 2 yrs ago for around $100 & now it's basically $200? Don't do it.Why? Well, the first finepix I had was just perfect in every way for a casual user. The orange was great, it really stood out, people always asked about it, was easy to find in a bag. It had a rechargeable battery, so you just plugged the cam in & voila, charging!... no extra attachments, no removing batteries, replacing, etc.There was little to no delay when taking photos, so easy to use. The buttons were conveniently placed, so no thumbs in the pics. The pictures were really crisp & clear. It was a well made sturdy cam, (however, you wouldn't think so, given mine broke haha). But the construction was so much better, than the Z, which feels more flimsy.With this Z, it just doesn't compare. When you turn it on, by sliding the front, of course you have a brief waiting period for it to load. THEN you may find yourself & your subjects holding your/their 'poses', for what seems an eternity, when you just want a quick, catch the moment, kind of shot. After you finally get your shot, chances are it will be blurry, or people having moved awkwardly, due to the wait/delay, so then, you have to take more. You will find yourself holding the button halfway, to fullway, just sort of bending to the camera's will, not vice versa. It is a fickle camera. The only time a delay would be nice, would be if you want to 'time' a shot, maybe something of a portrait nature. But for vacationing, random shots, this cam is a pain. It sort of shudders, acting as if it is going to take the pic, then it will stall, confusing the person attempting to take the pic, like 'what is wrong with this thing? is this normal?' side glance to me, leaving me just kind of shrugging, as if to say, 'yes, it is typical & a pain, please be patient.'I think the first finepix I had must have spoiled me, to read all of the glowing reviews on this cam. While I am not crazy about this cam, & would not recommend it, as there ARE better point & shoots out there for equal value or less, it is still better than a cheap kodak or something along that range.I probably should mention the video, it's ok, the sound ok, but again, just ok.I say if you are wanting a 3x (but why? upgrade now to 5x) & are willing to shell out $200, get the V10. Everything about it is better, & they are basically the same size. The V10 is constructed better, easier to use, little to no delay, nice video, no extra pieces to lug around & just overall > (greater than) the Z.BTW- When I say easier to use, it's like comparing a website that is easier to navigate, versus a website that is all clutter & annoying. Yet a cluttered annoying website, would be better than no website or a website using ancient script & cheap design.So, that's it, hope it wasn't too painful to read. This cam = 3 stars, wavering in the middle, it isn't the best, it isn't the worst, so keep looking, you can get better for the current price.

Reviews.Title: Great intro camera, but has it's flaws
Reviews.Author: Raine T
Reviews.Content: I got this camera a little over two years ago, and promptly lost the manual. I actually picked it because of the beautiful pink color it came in. I knew nothing about photography, so I just used the auto and other preset settings until about a week ago. I'll start with prior to using the manual shoot function.The construction of this camera is impressive. I'm a clutz, to say the least. I've dropped it a few times, both on carpet and hard flooring. It's had things spilled on it, and traveled all over. Aside from a few scatches near the function wheels and a weird scratch/smudge on the display, it's fine.Portability is fabulous! I take this camera literally everywhere I go, it's always in my purse. It's less than an inch thick, and 3-4 inces long. The battery lasts a considerable amount of time, and charges fast.Video quality is ok. It's not the best, but it's better than nothing for sure. I have taken videos at concerts that did not turn out well, one at Disneyland that turned out great, and a few of my dog that are great as well. The sound is very good. They take a very long time to upload onto my computer though. Also, if you shoot them holding the camera sideways, the video will remain sideways once you upload it. I haven't found a way to turn them the right way yet.Pictures...have been hit and miss. Sometimes I can get very good images, some VERY poor. The worst are in low lighting or at night, especially outdoors. I've tried using the "night" function, which results in streaky, odd looking photos EVERY SINGLE time. Not worth using. Another problem has been the zoom. Sometimes I can zoom in and get clear pictures, other times you can hardly tell what it's a picture of. If you use the "sport" setting, that works fairly well for anything that's moving, though they still don't come out perfect.The preset settings are cool. It has auto, snow, beach, sports, flower, natural, auction mode, portrait, landscape, sunset, museum, party, text, and anti-blur. They all have very clear descriptions displayed when you scroll onto them. I wish there were more, though.NOW, i've finally started learning some things, and messing around with the manual settings. I've been getting pictures of a MUCH higher quality, and more consistent. I wish I had learned to do this earlier. I have not tried this yet at night though, so don't know if that can be improved or not. I do still plan on upgrading to the FinePix F70EXR soon, but am happier with this one in the meantime. I would recommend this camera for someone that wants to learn but doesn't feel ready to jump into a DSLR or spend a lot of money. It's a good "learning camera".

Reviews.Title: 2 years old now and still great
Reviews.Author: Thomas Churchwell
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in November 07 and everything is still the way it was back then, "Great!"I use Canon DSLR's for my business but I always carry the fuji in my pocket when I am out and about and it has never disappointed me. It is a great camera

Reviews.Title: Photo quality is poor
Reviews.Author: kuoch
Reviews.Content: It has all the goods of a portable P&S;, but the photo quality is bad with poor colors. Menu selection is not user-friendly either.

Reviews.Title: Okay for a beginner...
Reviews.Author: Sl Judge "gatormomz"
Reviews.Content: As a mother of four, let's face it, I take a lot of pictures.  I thought this Fuji would be everything I wanted and then some.  Quite frankly, I have found it to be a disappointment. I have great difficulty getting a SHARP picture out of this camera. For the price, I should not have grainy pictures. The camera performs poorly in low lighting and forget the zoom entirely because it is not the best out there. With that said, for the beginner, this is a great first camera, but not at the current $200 price. You can get similar (minus the wireless feature) for $100.  I am currently looking to trade mine in for something else. I have been frustrated long enough. I shouldn't have to take 400 pictures in hopes of keeping a hundred and that is what I have to do.

Reviews.Title: Nice, but not fantastic!
Reviews.Author: CLP "C"
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I loved the color!  It doesn't take pictures well with any type of noise back ground.  They all seem to be blurry.  It takes great pictures outside, but this camera is very sensitive to lighting indoors.  I love the big screen to view pictures, but wish that it had easier viewing options.  I also bought this camera in pink and orange for my sister and mom.  They all have the same issues with their cameras as well.  Overall it works just fine.

Reviews.Title: cute camera, poor pic quality
Reviews.Author: A. Farrell
Reviews.Content: This is a really cute and fun camera. I bought it because it was pretty and small. Big mistake. I am by no means a techie, and I am sure there are several people out there who adore this camera. It's pretty easy to use and it has quick start up. It's small, cute, and trendy. But when compared to my rather old Nikon Coolpix, the picture quality is pathetic. I have had this camera for almost a year, and I am now in the market for yet another one -- I'm going back to Nikon. No matter how high I set the resolution, the pictures seem to always turn out grainy, and they are never very sharp. This goes for both indoors and outdoors. I have played with all of the settings and nothing seems to help the quality.This camera is great if someone is more concerned with style, but if you truly want a camera that takes outstanding photos that you can cherish for years to come, I suggest you keep looking! I really learned my lesson on buying for looks.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Noriko Asami "Noriko Asami"
Reviews.Content: I took more than 1000 pictures and many movies and upload Youtube. It is very good and I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Cam Fanatic
Reviews.Author: Micky T
Reviews.Content: Hands down, one of the best cameras on the market. I use it almost everyday.Great for just pictures with friends or family, or semi-professional photos.

Reviews.Title: Compact camera - Big pictures
Reviews.Author: In the AmaZone...
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera primarily because of its compact size.  It is one of the smallest good quality cameras on the market.  Obviously it can't compete with a Nikon D series or Canon Rebel, but if you read the manual and learn the right settings, it takes great quality photos for a point and shoot.  It has a rechargable lithium battery with long life, which is important because there is no viewfinder and all sighting is done on the large LCD screen.  The controls and menu are easy to manage.  For my first digital Fuji, I am impressed.  The price has gone up since I bought it, but at the $117 I paid, I thought I got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Good quailty for a good price
Reviews.Author: A. Greer
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it has great picture quality and it's user friendly. All of the pictures I take are very crisp and clear and it's perfect for any time of day, any light inside and outside. I absoultly would not trade this camera in for the world and I think if you're making the decision wether to buy this or not that you have found the perfect camera for you and you should go ahead and buy it, you won't be disappointed. And I'm not an easy sell either.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Burns "SuperFamily"
Reviews.Content: Great camera for point and shoot. Very user friendly and great for pre-teens like my daughter. I have a 2MB card for it shooting up to 30 minutes of video. My daughter loves this camera. Also, the internal battery is a great plus - you don't have to buy any AA or AAA batteries. This camera has many plus features.

Reviews.Title: fuji finepix
Reviews.Author: R. Leedy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 12 year old daughter as a Christmas gift.  She loved it.  It is extremely easy to use and compact. Would definetly recommend this model for anyone.  Amazon made my first experience purchasing on the internet very easy.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the $
Reviews.Author: Blair N. Sellon
Reviews.Content: My husband received this camera as a present, prior we were using the finepix 2 megapix from 2001, we thought that was OK just humungus!  This fuji Z10 is so tiny but takes great pics and even better videos.  He was so happy with this gift, we would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: Do not expect too much
Reviews.Author: Durukan Payzanoglu
Reviews.Content: Overall a very compact and light weight camera ideal for taking photos of unimportant occasions. But for this price, one should not expect tact sharp images.Pros: Very good macro performance. Face detection (if it can detect)provides very good exposure and focusing under ideal lighting conditions.Cons: Very slow low light focusing, too much high iso noise (including iso 400), extensive loss of sharpness on the far right and left edges in wide angle shots and some purple artifacts on vertical lines of buildings.

Reviews.Title: Good Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Reviewed By A "Reviewer In"
Reviews.Content: This little camera is a little workhorse. With my 4gb SDHC card, I can take over 1100 photos at 7.2 megapixel fine mode. I really enjoy this little camera when I am outside and a need to take photos on trips. It functions appropriately given the size of the aperture (i.e., you have to use the flash inside when it is dark, and your target has to be less than 10 feet away for the shot to be good). If you want a real good indoor camera or a camera with a big zoom, I recommend its bigger brother the S5000. Yet, in full daylight or even on an overcast day, it is comparable to an ISO 800 disposable film camera by the same manufacturer, except it has a 3x zoom. I like the blog mode, and the auction mode. It is very simple, and my mother has just got herself one (and she simply adores it). I get about 300 shots per charge, and I recommend this camera (I also recommend reading the specs and the owners manual to get the best use out of it).

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Jayson Smeltzer
Reviews.Content: little late in the mail but could have been ups fault got what i paid for

Reviews.Title: Fuji Z10fd  7.2MP Digital Camera with 3X OPTICAL
Reviews.Author: S. Mansell
Reviews.Content: Opened it up on Christmas morning and the pictures were as good as the Olympic 7.2MP as my parents own and paid much more.  The only thing I was disappointed in is that there was no cartiage which made it difficult to store pictures as the hard drive was limited.  Keep up the effort in coming up with an affordable good quality product.

Reviews.Title: digital camera
Reviews.Author: R. Matthews
Reviews.Content: I haven't had this camera for very long but so far I love it. It takes awesome pictures and it's super cute.

Reviews.Title: This camera is the WORST
Reviews.Author: T. Ehmcke "Shutterbug"
Reviews.Content: I cannot tell you how terribly disappointed I am in this camera, each and every time I load the photos in my computer.  Yes, managing the settings is very easy and the thing is very cute and small so fits into any pocket.  But what good is a camera with results that can't be predicted?  What good are the special settings if you know they will produce a blurry photo, all except the very brightest settings?  When it was brand new, I got one nice landscape shot but portraits, parties, friends, special occasions, including my San Francisco debut, was ruined because of a very poor quality camera.  Don't waste your money on this one.  Save a little more and spend it on a Canon or, better still, a good Nikon or Canon SLR.  I cannot wait until I've saved my pennies enough to be able to buy a decent digital camera and dump this one.

Reviews.Title: cool
Reviews.Author: Timothy Yinka Odeneye
Reviews.Content: i love my cam cam, i named her Lisa. That's how much I love it

Reviews.Title: Horrible Customer Service!!!
Reviews.Author: C. Allen "Jason Logue"
Reviews.Content: The camera will do what you need it to do as long as nothing goes wrong.  The customer care people at fuji bounce you from one person to another and will do everything in their power not to help you.  For this reason I would not recommend any fujifilm camera and I would look at the Canon, Nikon, or Olympus brands.  Compared to fuji their customer service is like night and day.  Hope this helps.Jason Logue

Reviews.Title: wow. so bad it's almost funny.
Reviews.Author: rainyjewels
Reviews.Content: I've been in search of the perfect camera for a while - relatively sleek and good-looking, and takes sharp clear photos with true color reproduction (even w/flash). Having seen the brilliant performance of Fuji's F30 and somewhat good quality of the Z5 (though not comparable to the F30), I thought the Z10, being the newest model with the newest technology, should be THE one. It's not.This camera takes worse pictures than the clunky Sony camera I bought 6 years ago. The pictures look okay on the camera, but when uploaded to a bigger monitor, there is so much pixelation it's incredible. I called my friends over to look at them, and we were all baffled to the point where we just had to laugh in disbelief. The pictures look like they could've come out of a toy camera. Blacks look blue/purple. Even outdoors the pictures come out pixelated and noisy, even at the lowest ISO settings in bright daylight. It just doesn't get any worse than that when it comes to cameras. I shipped it back the very next day I got it. Definitely do not recommend, unless you're looking for a cheap camera toy to give to a teenager/child who couldn't care less about taking a quality photo. What a disappointment from Fuji - how can they make something like the F30 and then come out with this garbage?

ProductInfo.Features:
7.2-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality 15 x 20-inch prints
3x optical zoom with Picture Stabilization; 2.5-inch LCD display
Face Detection optimizes focus/exposure for up to 10 faces; Blog Mode copies 640 x 480 version of image for easy upload
Wirelessly transfer images to IrSimple-equipped devices, including other digital cameras
Stores images on xD or SD memory cards (not included); powered by lithium-ion battery (battery and charger included)
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm Finepix Z10fd 7.2MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Hot Pink)
